result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 04/15/2016 or penalty of 6 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Gamino Law Office

Defendant Martin Rodriguez in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $442.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 4/15/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 6 days in Huber
Sentencing hearing at 03-21-2016 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Martin Rodriguez in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Jayne Dewire and Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to charge #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1. Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Martin Rodriguez did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Defendant has engaged Anger Management Treatment.  Attorney Williams Buttery moves to set this case for a plea hearing.  State has no objections.  Court denies the request.  Court leaves this matter on for trial.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing at 01-14-2016 08:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-19-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery in court.   Defendant Martin Rodriguez did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Court will conduct voir dire at the jury trial.  Parties to file any voir dire questions by the jury status hearing.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to appear
